item.title: Announcing flake8-diff
item.description:
Purpose

This utility allows you to run flake8 over a set of changed files and filter out violations that would be introduced by merging those changes.

We use this as part of our build / CI infrastructure to alert developers opening pull requests to new violations their pull request will introduce, if it were merged.

item.title: Forking background processes in Python
item.description: This post attempts to explain how to fork child processes in Python, or at least how to use forking on an existing Python script. For some strange reason I’ve had to explain this a few times recently, so I decided an easy to reference blog post would probably make life a little easier.

item.title: Replacing Django's Nasty 'runserver'
item.description: Have you ever tried to have more than one person view a development site using Django’s built-in development server ? Yeah, it really sucks. Apparently concurrency wasn’t high on the features list and they have stated that it never will be.
